name: PaymentCardReaderError
desc: An error type that indicates problems with the configuration of the reader.

items.name: case accountAlreadyLinked
items.desc: An error that indicates the merchant accepted the Terms of Service using a different Apple ID.

items.name: case accountLinkingCancelled
items.desc: An error that indicates the user canceled the linking operation.

items.name: case accountLinkingFailed
items.desc: An error that indicates the system couldn’t link the merchant using the provided Apple ID.

items.name: case accountLinkingRequiresiCloudSignIn
items.desc: An error that indicates the merchant must be signed into iCloud to accept the Terms of Service.

items.name: case accountNotLinked
items.desc: An error that indicates the merchant must accept the Terms of Service with a valid Apple ID.

items.name: case backgroundRequestNotAllowed
items.desc: An error that results from requests to the reader while the host app is in the background state.

items.name: case deviceBanned(Date?)
items.desc: An error that indicates the device is banned until the specified date.

items.name: case emptyReaderToken
items.desc: An error that indicates the reader token is empty, which is invalid.

items.name: case invalidMerchant
items.desc: An error that indicates the merchant is invalid or unknown.

items.name: case invalidReaderToken(String?)
items.desc: An error that indicates an invalid, non-empty reader token.

items.name: case merchantBlocked
items.desc: An error that indicates the merchant is blocked.

items.name: case modelNotSupported
items.desc: An error that indicates the current device isn’t supported.

items.name: case networkAuthenticationError
items.desc: An authentication error that occurred during connection to the server.

items.name: case networkError
items.desc: A network error.

items.name: case notAllowed
items.desc: An error usually caused by an entitlement issue, an invalid application bundle, a configuration issue, or a token issue.

items.name: case notReady
items.desc: An error that indicates the reader session isn’t ready.

items.name: case osVersionNotSupported
items.desc: An error that indicates the current OS version isn’t supported.

items.name: case passcodeDisabled
items.desc: An error that indicates the device doesn’t have an active passcode.

items.name: case prepareExpired
items.desc: An error that indicates the reader session expired.

items.name: case prepareFailed(String?)
items.desc: An error that indicates preparation failed.

items.name: case readerBusy
items.desc: An error that indicates the card reader is busy.

items.name: case readerMemoryFull
items.desc: An error that indicates the reader’s internal memory is full.

items.name: case serviceConnectionError
items.desc: An error that indicates an internal service is unavailable.

items.name: case tokenExpired
items.desc: An error that indicates the reader’s token expired.

items.name: case unsupported
items.desc: An error that indicates unsupported hardware or a problem with the device.

items.name: var errorDescription: String
items.desc: A plain-text description of the error.

items.name: var errorName: String
items.desc: The name of the error.
